website_summaries.verdict: If you want a gas edger for a medium-sized plot, it's tough to beat.
pros: Strong performance and great flexibility for a surprisingly low price
cons: Heavy compared to an electric edger

website_summaries.verdict: This sturdy gas-powered edger has more options such as cutting beveled edges, and is easy to start.
pros: The manual recoil fuel deliver system makes the machine easy to start
5 depth positions cut up to 2" deep
Blade angle adjusts +/- 15 degrees to help create bevel edges
Sturdy metal frame and blade guard.3-point blade
cons: Engine was not strong enough for some users

website_summaries.verdict: With 5 depth positions up to an impressive 2.5 inches and guards to protect the frame and blade, this model earns high marks for its flexibility and durability.
pros: With the variety of depth positions available and the tilt blade for bevel cutting, users get the exact cut they prefer
Cuts stay even thanks to curb-hopper technology, which allows wheels to adjust to uneven spots without affecting blade position
The frame and blade guards protect the edger from debris
cons: The wheels may not turn as easily around curved areas, making those more difficult to trim evenly

website_summaries.verdict: Walk-behind 79 cc OHV engine gas edger with easy-start and bevel edging capability – best for light work when you want ease of use over power.
pros: Adjustable to 5 depths – up to 2.5 inches
Blade angle adjusts +/- 15º for bevel edging capabilities
Metal frame and blade guard for increased durability
cons: Low engine power, and non-adjustable stationary throttle speed

customer_reviews.title: Beware!! Machine lacks power and will not run at idle.DONOTBUY No returns
customer_reviews.text: Beware!! Machine lacks power and will not run at idle. I just got it and it wont work for us, but NO RETURNS on this item! Don't buy it, its not worth it. DONOTBUY
customer_reviews.author: SuperConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Very poor experience for me
customer_reviews.text: I received the Edger put it together and immediately started to use it, I found that it was underpowered so I had to go a little slower then I expected but that was okay. One week later I go out the my garage that the thing is leaking all of it's oil onto the floor from the bottom of the motor. Not what I would expect to a brand new motor. Very poor experience for me.
customer_reviews.author: Charles E Moon JR

customer_reviews.title: It gets a 1 because it ran.... afterwards is another story
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, and worked great in straight lines. The curb hopper adjustments weren't wide enough to run center wheel on curb, but I just went flat the other direction. I used it once, then left town for a week for work and came home to it sitting in a pile of its own oil. The entire volume of oil had leaked out.
customer_reviews.author: Mark R

customer_reviews.title: Great product, simple to put together
customer_reviews.text: Read all the reviews before buying. My experience was positive... edger went together in less than 20 minutes and very simple. does outstanding job edging no issues. Remember if you're edging for the first time it takes a couple passes this thing doesn't perform miracles if you've never have edged before. Being a Prime member for a while now I am disappointed that it arrived a day late. What am I paying for if it doesn't get here when it says it's supposed to be here?
customer_reviews.author: Al Smith

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 3 months then broke down and wouldn't start.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this edger but after 3 months it broke down and was leaking gas. Tried to return this and they wouldn't accept and had a limited warranty so I couldn't get a new edger. Loved the edger but not the shelf life and they will not offer returns even if they ship you a defective product and you want to return it that week.
customer_reviews.author: CFSteph

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding edger for the money.  Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Don't understand the negative reviews. Came through UPS, packaging was good, all parts received, went together exactly as per instructions, started on 2nd pull, used it immediately on a lawn that has never been edged. Did a great job, plenty of power. Since it was a never before edged lawn, I made first pass at minimum depth and when back over twice more at deeper depths - worked like a champ. Used it again today at my set depth and it was amazing how fast I got done. I have corner lot with sidewalks. If you follow instructions and take time to get to know machine you will be very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Bart H.

customer_reviews.title: Works once!
customer_reviews.text: Live in Florida, it was delivered in Dec 18. I used it one time with no problems, fired up on second pull. Here it is May of 2019 and it will not start. Customer service spat out the owners manual quote of "if you don't use it for 30 you need fuel stabilizer" and hung up on me. I will never buy this name brand again. Garbage, my chain saw sits in the shed for over 10 months and will start after 4 pulls. Garbage!!
customer_reviews.author: mary dreeszen

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware. Don’t Buy Unless You Want You Garage Floor to Be an Oil Painting
customer_reviews.text: When it decides to work, it does an ok job. The blade gets dull easily and the unit isn’t strong enjoy to cut heavy Bermuda runners, so they’ll get tangled and stall it out. If that were the only problem, I’d likely be much happier. The main issue is it leaks oil like it’s its job. I have to sit it on an oil pan sheet in the garage. I suspect a crack in the housing somewhere. Annoying and inconvenient. And random chooses when it wants to work and when it doesn’t. Some days I can’t get it started at all. Complete train wreck. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Nickdotnet

customer_reviews.title: Really worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: This little edger does the job quite well. Not the easiest to assemble, but not overly difficult either if you’re mildly mechanically inclined. Don’t expect this edger to go plowing through wet ground and over growth like butter. It’s not made to do that. As long as you don’t let the edging go wild, this works like a dream. Starts right up on the first or second pull, every time.
customer_reviews.author: Rob S.

customer_reviews.title: This item came last night. The box is badly ...
customer_reviews.text: This item came last night. The box is badly damaged. I have several pictures. Due to a death in the family, I cannot inspect it until I get back. Just wanted to go on record about this.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Shaw

customer_reviews.title: so far so good,  had to get last edging in before winter
customer_reviews.text: Tuff for me to put together, Box banged-up, some parts scattered in box Started Quick, Even Neighbor used - Liked
customer_reviews.author: GARY

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this edger, it’s a great machine.
customer_reviews.text: This edger works great! It’s old school but considering the price and the fact it uses regular gas, this is a fantastic value. No mixing oil, no hassles with weed eater line, easy to assemble, and it started from the first pull. People say this leaks oil but mine didn’t drip a drop, probably because I was careful to not over fill the oil. You don’t need to add the entire bottle of oil. Fill based on the dipstick and you’ll have no issues. The instructions say use the whole bottle but the unit has some oil in it so it won’t take the full bottle of oil to fill it. I would recommend this edger, it’s a great machine.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Colson

customer_reviews.title: It Works but Wish it Had a Blade Guide
customer_reviews.text: It starts, it runs, it works. The wheels aren’t easy to adjust for curb work so I wind up using the weed whacker for those areas. But this does save my busted shoulder from so much weed whacker work so its worth it. My biggest beef is I wish it had a blade guide. Since it does not have one, it beats up the concrete a lot and the blade is wearing fast; my driveway is curved in places. It starts on the 1st or 2nd pull and isn’t particularly hard to pull start. All in all it works for what I need it for. It replaced a junk all in 1 whacker edger.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Boykin

customer_reviews.title: Southland SWLE0799 79cc Walk Behind Gas Lawn Edger
customer_reviews.text: Bought in December and received in March because they were sold out. It came well packaged and assembly was easy. The wait was well worth it. I had an electric Craftsman edger which took me about 2-3 hours with set up and edge. The unit started right up and I was looking for the throttle control but realized that it is a set speed. I was very impress with the ease of use. Heck I was done in 15-20 minutes. Now I think I'll do my neighbors just for fun. I am thinking about trying the walk behind weed eater by Southland because this product is very good quality and I am very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Gator Spotter

customer_reviews.title: For the price i’m satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t like the wheel configuration for edging the top of a curb. Walkways everything is fine. This is a good edger for a homeowner. I expect it will last a few years easy as long as I’m not putting ethanol in it. However, I wouldn’t buy it if I needed it for commercial use. Seems the deck metal isn’t as thick and sturdy as in my edgers-past and the inner wheels are made of plastic. I suspect it has been made overseas. But for the price I’m satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stickdog

customer_reviews.title: Look no further you found it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Very easy to use and operate for the average homeowner. Makes light or deep cuts just for that perfect look. Curbs are no problem because it has an adjustment wheel that slowed for easy adjustment to raise or lower one of the wheels. Easy to start “pull start” save your money and by this product don’t over spend on a higher priced edger when you don’t have to. Just add gas set your depth and go.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: What a BREEZE to use
customer_reviews.text: First, the assembly. It's sorta buried in the small print, but "Some Assembly IS Required." It's not difficult, though. Just read the instructions carefully. Second, the use. What a breeze to use! It starts repeatedly in a flash -- and the starting cord is easy to pull. And once it gets running, it takes just a couple minutes to "get the hang of it." After that, it almost edges by itself. The blade tends to apply enough forward pressure to draw the edger along the sidewalk or driveway, and it seems to hold a straight path with very little guiding effort by the user. Okay, so it hasn't made this whole "edging chore" FUN, but it's certainly a LOT easier.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: OK for $248.00
customer_reviews.text: It's been a year that I've had the Southland SWLE0799 79cc Walk Behind Gas Lawn Edger. I bought it when the price was $248 and I feel that I got slightly less than what I paid for. For 250 yards of edging carpet grass with silty soil, it's a bit under-powered. Unless the engine is very hot, you must choke to start each time. The metal ratchets and springs in the otherwise plastic starter recoil fell out at 12-months. Those parts are discontinued so I had to buy a replacement unit for $30.
customer_reviews.author: TP Cortez

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: Took way to long to setup and was missing 2 screws and nuts. After spending an hour getting everything going i started it up and went to go edge the driveway and street. After 10 minutes of using it, it started conking out. Checked the oil, gas and spark plug and everything looked fine. Started it up and would die every 30 seconds. Called to return but was unable to since there was gas and oil in it already. So now am stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Southland walk behind gasoline powered edger
customer_reviews.text: I've used my edger 4 times, with 80' of driveway, and 160' of curb, with zero problems. The edger works perfect, quick, and fires up on the first or second pull. Very easy on fuel, Zero oil leaks, or any leaks in fact. Tire height adjustments are very tight, and takes some effort to adjust, but I like it that way myself. I in fact, like my edger very well. I would buy another. No disappointments!
customer_reviews.author: Ozark Mountains

customer_reviews.title: Good edger for the money
customer_reviews.text: For the money this machine does the job.I’ve done a few edging jobs with it and does a fine job.The only problem I’ve seen so far is that it is hard to start when hot.My old one had a Briggs and Stratton engine and was the same way.If you want a better starting engine you’ll have to step up to a Honda edger but you can buy five of these for the price of a Honda.I don’t do that much edging so not worth it to me....
customer_reviews.author: LJ Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit and when i received it, the gas tank was crushed. I was told to throw it away and they would send another. Instead, I ordered a new gas tank and put it on the damaged one and therefore had 2 edgers so I gave one to my neighbor. After a couple of uses, both edgers became extremely hard to start; sometimes taking 20-30 pulls. When it finally starts, it bogs down very easily. I went back to using my 20 year old Murray that is on it's last let. These edgers are absolute garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A France

customer_reviews.title: Like New is misleading
customer_reviews.text: If I could attach pictures I certainly would. This item was reboxed in a visibly damaged box. When I realized there were missing parts I called the vendor. The Southland representative was very professional and patient. I described the items that were missing and asked to get specific sizes because it was not listed in the manual. The other issue that I'm experiencing is starting. There's no real quick start. The idle has to be in a certain spot to crank if the engine is warm, as well as, if the engine is cold. Otherwise, I like the ability to cut a clean edge from the curb. It's easy to handle and guide while trimming.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was a cinch and took maybe 15 minutes total after reading instructions. Only standard tools are needed. This edger does a tremendous job and has already saved me hours of labor over using my trimmer edging attachment. I have over 600' of edges between the driveway and boulevard with sidewalk, which I can now complete in 30 minutes or less. The motor a little finnicky but I can always get it restarted.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A. Garlough

customer_reviews.title: Great Value. ****LEAKS OIL****
customer_reviews.text: Well built, started on first pull. Runs quietly. UPDATE: after a few days in my garage it leaked oil all over my floor. I followed the directions and used the entire contents of the 12oz bottle of oil it was shipped with. I am now in the position of being forced to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Chef JP

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected. Plenty of power. Hard to start when warm.
customer_reviews.text: It works great but it is dangerous. It is easy to start when cold but hard to start when warm. The blades spins any time the motor is running and it is right up front. Since it is hard to start when warm, you will try to keep it running but the blade is always spinning so you have to be careful. It does a nice job of walking the curb. I think I will have to keep a couple of extra blades around.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Tinari

customer_reviews.title: Great edger...great power and great price
customer_reviews.text: The edger was easy to assemble. I have a very long property line with a sidewalk. This edger gets after it! Hope it lasts but so far I am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Antionette

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE! Amazon cannot return or replace this item. Mine does not run!! Southland customer service is a joke, very rude people. The edger will not stay running without it being on full choke. Evidently this is a KNOWN ISSUE . They told me to take it to their service dept people,guess what? It’s 40 miles from me. This was a straight out of the box issue. Not something that happened after use. I guess I’m out 250 bucks. VERY DISAPPOINTED in this item.
customer_reviews.author: Amy P.

customer_reviews.title: Great old-style edger
customer_reviews.text: This is a great edger. It has plenty of power to cut a good trench. It is well worth the money if you want an old style gasoline edger.
customer_reviews.author: MDP

customer_reviews.title: This is good on a straight cut but is difficult to use ...
customer_reviews.text: This is good on a straight cut but is difficult to use on curves. The manual curb wheel adjustment is clumsy. It is easy starting.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, started on the 2nd pull. I ran it for about 3 hours it did a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Leon

customer_reviews.title: Works well once you get it started.
customer_reviews.text: I wish the starting process was better. I'm only 5'1 and it's very difficult for me to start it. It takes several pulls to get this started and sometimes it will flood out and I have to wait. If we ever have to replace this one, hopefully I'll be able to find one that is easier to start. The edger does do a very good job.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I had none of the issues others had
customer_reviews.text: I was worried after reading the negative reviews. I didn't have any of their issues. I found it easy to assemble, easy to start and did a good job.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C

customer_reviews.title: Southland Edger
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the edger because of price and reviews. It really works well for residential work. Not a commercial machine but does do light to medium edging very well. No problems with the engine runs fine with no leaks. Purchase the star blade for best clean cut edges. Have used this machine for two years with no problems. Curb wheels also work well. All in all a great bang for your buck compared to other machines.
customer_reviews.author: marco

customer_reviews.title: Trim the Driveway
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and very easy to start and to operate.
customer_reviews.author: S. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good machine for an obvious import
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good machine for an obvious import. Ran well right out of the box. Light assembly required but not a big issue. Expect to buy a replacement blade soon after using it because the supplied one is pretty easy to bend/soft.
customer_reviews.author: dana harvey

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Started after several attempts; ran for two seconds - stalled. WILL NOT start; will not run. I would've spent less time edging with a shovel than I did messing with this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Declined

customer_reviews.title: It might be ok if you already have a good edge on your yard and diligently maintain it
customer_reviews.text: As others have said this doesn't have the power to cut through heavy soil and make new edgings. It might be ok if you already have a good edge on your yard and diligently maintain it. Also, ours had a bad carb and it quit working after about 90 seconds. The carburetor is not covered under warranty. The repair shop stated "bad fuel" but it was new fuel and being used in a power washer, mower, etc. with only this item not working. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Very effective, reliable edger.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for edging around the perimeter of the lawn inside the cement curbing. It gives a great one inch spacing. When the lawn is then mowed there is no need to use a spinning trimmer. The lawn edge looks very crisp anyway. The edger only needs to be used approximately monthly or thereabouts. It has started easily and has good power to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: DF

customer_reviews.title: Read before buying
customer_reviews.text: Heed the warnings from others, run do not walk, or if you have an extra $200 plus donate it and buy a more reliable product. So I purchased this product worked great next day dead on start up. Sent it in for repairs, unrepairable. Spent another $400 acquiring a reliable product. So let’s tally it up $600 for a $400 dollar edger. I could have donated the first $200 and made out the same. I’m not upset, because I too read the reviews. For those machines that are working to day, I wish I had your model.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product fairly easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to assemble with the exception of putting the wheels on. Two people really needed for easier assembly. Was able to do it by myself but had to place it on work bench to reach better. Once assembled easy to start, easy to use. Clean up very easy. Very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Browning

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Negatives: It’s hard to start. If the dipstick is pointing down, oil will drain out when parked. So make sure the front end is all the way up when parked Positives: The curb hopping feature is awesome! It’s very simple to use. Doesn’t burn much fuel at all.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ducote

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as we wanted
customer_reviews.text: very easy to assemble. Starts easily and edges great. It takes a little practice to get the narrow professional edges, but after a couple of uses, you should be able to figure it out. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: poppa york

customer_reviews.title: Started 2nd pull.
customer_reviews.text: This edger worked great for me I did not have any of the problems that I saw another reviews it started on the second pull and did my whole yard which is large. Seems to have plenty of power all in all a good edger for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Powerful enough for any edging job.
customer_reviews.text: Used to edge a sidewalk that had not been edged in a long time. Grass was grown over sidewalk. Worked well. Had to ma k ever v real passes. Started easily. Very easy to use and edges very well.
customer_reviews.author: Charles P. Palmer, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Edger works as advertised and is easy to start. Complaints about starting can be solved by using a half-choke setting to start it when it is warm. Compares favorably to a d&r edger costing more then a hundred dollars more. Have used it 5 times about an hour each time with no issues
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R Little

customer_reviews.title: Curb hopper
customer_reviews.text: Great tool to get out long side walk edges done. The curb hop feature works but is a little difficult to adjust when the engine is hot. Came with everything need to get started except fuel.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: WILL NOT START AFTER 2 YEARS.
customer_reviews.text: IT RAN OK FOR A WHILE, IT WAS HARD TO START, BUT NOW THE MOTOR ONLY DEVELOPS 40 LBS COMPRESSION AND IT WILL NOT START. FEEL LIKE I WASTED MY MONEY. DOUBT THAT CAN GET PISTON RINGS FOR THE MOTOR THAT WAS POORLY MADE IN CHINA. NOW IT WILL MAKE A GREAT BOAT ANCHOR. THEIR 800 NUMBER TECHNICIAN HAD NO SPECS ON THE ENGINE SHAFT SIZE, BOLT HOLE SPACING ETC. REALLY SURPRIZED AMAZON SELLS THIS WORTHLESS SCRAP. DO EVEN THINK ABOUT IT .
customer_reviews.author: LUCKY 7 OR KELLY

customer_reviews.title: Unit leaks oil
customer_reviews.text: I added the oil and used the unit once and noticed the mats I keep under my lawn equipment had oil on it the following week. So I took this outside and fully washed and put it back away again on top of some cardboard. The next week I looked again and there was oil again under the unit. I have tried to contact support and I am not having any luck. I would suggest purchasing something else.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler LaFountaine

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: The unit arrived missing key parts and so the oil ran out on the garage floor as fast as I put it in. The unit will not restart after it gets warmed up (5 minutes). It even arrives with a pre-printed card listing reasons it might not run right! The SELLER'S AGENT IS NOT RESPONSIVE TO PROBLEMS! Even Amazon won't back it. Still want to buy? Mine only has 20 minutes run time - I will sell it cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value.  Powerful.  Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Instructions to assemble could have been much easier/useful, but overall not enough to discount much Lots of power and that’s what I wanted. Very easy and versatile settings Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.author: D. DeBerry

customer_reviews.title: Great Valie
customer_reviews.text: Edger arrived in perfect condition. All parts were packed well and were complete. Added the oil, gas and it started the 2nd pull. It will bog down if you try to make the first cut to deep. I made two passes and it worked perfect. For the price it’s very well made and runs quiet. I like the adjustability for trimming the street curbs.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Middleton

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this thing! Works great. No more breaking his back with the handheld model. There are some bad reviews. I don’t get it. This is phenomenal, honestly.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: It is underpowered and poorly made.  JUNK
customer_reviews.text: I received the edger , assembled it, and put fuel in it. It leaked gaso all over the floor. I contacted Southland and we determined that there was a gasket missing from the gas tank. They said they would ship the gasket to me but that it would take two weeks. That did fix the leak but the edger does not start very often. I have been able to use it 2 times and it is underpowered. It is cheaply made and does a very poor job. Do not buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Smith

customer_reviews.title: Edge with ease. Pre dig for easy trenching
customer_reviews.text: Used for edging. You can angle the cut for a clean edge. Also used it to pre dig a trench for my PVC sprinklers. It made it easy to finish with my pick. Pre
customer_reviews.author: Richard P. Apgar

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t take a rocket scientist to put this together. Took 10 minutes. Didn’t even need the instructions. Put the oil in and the gas and started on the second pull. Almost identical to the Homelite edger I had for 14 years.
customer_reviews.author: H. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Leaks Oil
customer_reviews.text: Works great but leaks Oil. I read other reviews and this was a problem. I made the mistake of thinking these were exceptions. Oil leaks after first use.
customer_reviews.author: Gerard Pittman

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I have a corner lot with plenty of linear sidewalk feet. I got tired of renting an edger...schedule a time it's available, go pick it up, rush to get it back in 2 hours for 40$ a pop. so yes this thing works. It went together easy and starts easy. It does the job on a 60 year old sunken sidewalk and curb. It might be a little under powered true, but you can figure it out and the design is good. Maybe a little special needs but way better than renting. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L Hegge

customer_reviews.title: The negative reviews is BS
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy because of some of the reviews. They must of been written by the competition, they were so wrong. Delivered one day early, was packaged perfectly, easily assembled, started up 2nd pull, no problem with restarts, absolutely no oil leaks. Follow the directions and all will go well. Best Buy in its price range.
customer_reviews.author: gary alberson

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use and maintenance
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble it was easy to use instructions were very simple I'm a single mom and I cut my grass yesterday used it for the very first time and my lawn looks fabulous
customer_reviews.author: Dawn renee witt

customer_reviews.title: Edger does not work
customer_reviews.text: From the beginning, it was hard to start I used it three times since I bought it May 21, 2019 On Oct 15, 2020 I tried to use it it would not start I cleaned the spark plug and pored new gasoline but it still didn't start Now I have a edger that I payed $230 that won't start I would like to return it so I car buy an edger that works
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Nice edger
customer_reviews.text: Very nice edger easy to assemble works great 20th power
customer_reviews.author: Mannus Foster

customer_reviews.title: Won’t start, brand new!  Trouble from the beginning. Not good. Sending it back!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot get the new edger to start. Tore the skin off my finger trying to start it! So frustrating. Can’t review anything else because I have never used it! Going to send it back. Any why would their tech help not be available on the weekend when most people work in their yard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Under Powered
customer_reviews.text: for a 79 cc engine it lacks POWER. Chokes out often even edging at the 1st level Very frustrating. Spend the extra money and buy another brand with a more powerful engine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine, better if it didn’t leak oil
customer_reviews.text: Works well but leaks oil. Double checked oil level, looked for obvious leak but not found... yet. Just a teaspoon or so a day but aggravating. Too troublesome to return this big item. If it continues I will pull the engine and and check torque on crankcase bolts. Once this is fixed I expect to be happy with this edger.
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: wont start unless i prime it
customer_reviews.text: runs good does the job it was supposed to do. I have 2 issues 1.) it wont start unless i prime it with quick start 2.) (minor issue) the spring steel latch the allows the blade to move up or down is very stiff and a little difficult to manage. overall review this is adequate for the job it is intended to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaks oil!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing leaked oil all over my garage floor. What a mess to have to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan P.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: For the money it works pretty good. I personally was going for a more commercial type edger because all the plastic parts will not hold up. We've used it twice and so far it hasn't fallen apart.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Great product, get the job done right!
customer_reviews.text: The adjustments and strength of this work horse is great! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Real reviews

customer_reviews.title: Problems !!
customer_reviews.text: Unable to use myself. Could not start. Other adults were successful. Callers for support but apparently not strong enough. Will have to depend on others for help.
customer_reviews.author: marshman

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hard to start the first couple of times I used it but now works great
customer_reviews.author: John Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this item.
customer_reviews.text: I would never purchase this item again. We followed all assembly instructions, including adding the correct amount of oil. We used it once and since then all the oil has drained out of the edger. There is apparently no way to contact the seller to discuss this matter either
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Bowles

customer_reviews.title: Carb Issue
customer_reviews.text: Well built. Have to put in choke mode to start even after it is warmed up.
customer_reviews.author: KLBuster

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use, straight edge.
customer_reviews.text: The first edger we received was defective, won’t start. The customer service rep. sent a NEW replacement right away and it works great. We love the nice edge it leaves behind and it’s easy to use, not aback breaker like our old one.
customer_reviews.author: CINDY RICHARDS

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, great product.
customer_reviews.text: Finally a reasonably priced edger that works! The pull start is a little finicky but works well. Cuts nice.
customer_reviews.author: S R. Sims

customer_reviews.title: This was supposed to be credited
customer_reviews.text: This was supposed to be credit to my account. This edger didn’t shut off. Amazon said that they were crediting my account
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Time saver
customer_reviews.text: Great job for the price. Cuts work time down so much compaired to edging by hand. Would highly recommend 👌
customer_reviews.author: Kendall

customer_reviews.title: The more he uses the more in love he gets
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this. The more he uses the more in love he gets.
customer_reviews.author: MONICA

customer_reviews.title: leaks oil
customer_reviews.text: Although this does a great job the one time we got to use it. The oil continues to leak out all over the garage. How frustrating to spend so much money on something to have this happen.
customer_reviews.author: David N.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good edger
customer_reviews.text: Makes my edging goes faster than using a weed eater, Have not used a real edger in 40 years. I was expecting the 79 cc engine to be more powerful however and the curb wheel does not track straight.
customer_reviews.author: Ghost

customer_reviews.title: good product.
customer_reviews.text: Little bit short on power and hard to adjust the right rear drop wheel for curbs but otherwise it is a good product. Starts easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jim J

customer_reviews.title: Does the work for you.
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in just a couple of days and was just what I needed.Had my sidewalk edged in just a few mins.Did a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not to happy
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received was broken . I received a second one after one use . I left it in my garage an the whole oil came out
customer_reviews.author: Emms

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: The dam thing ran for 2 minutes then died and I'm told I can't return it !!!!! What a bunch of crap
customer_reviews.author: Gail S.

customer_reviews.title: Non- reliable edger for big price
customer_reviews.text: Had edger less than 1 year. Put it away for winter and went to start in spring and would not start. Did all recommended winter prep.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice edge lines
customer_reviews.text: Easy starting and runs very well. I use it almost daily for my landscaping business.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good buy
customer_reviews.text: I found all the negative reviews false. Mine was easy to assemble, did not leak oil and easy to start. It trims very well and like all edgers if you haven’t edged before you might have to go over a section a couple times to develop the groove adjacent to the pavement.
customer_reviews.author: Bennie Coates

customer_reviews.title: Excellent equipment, fair price!
customer_reviews.text: My third edger in 30+ years and it is carrying the legacy. Really pleased. Does an excellent job.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Reed

customer_reviews.title: a great edger
customer_reviews.text: Came well packaged , a great quality machine, easy to assemble , basicly just attach the wheels ,great instruction booklet ,,, and started up first pull
customer_reviews.author: joel h.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. PRODUCT IS TRASH.
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE!!! STAY AWAY!!! Assembled item as instructed. Added oil as instructed. Used for less than 15 minutes to trim driveway. Oil started leaking out of crankcase. Return wasn’t accepted. Complete waste of money. Do not buy this product. It is trash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but leaks oil
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble and runs fine, but when I put it in my garage I have to put something under it because it leaks oil. I am constantly putting oil in it but do not know where it is coming from. Would not purchase this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Wolverine 21

customer_reviews.title: Will not stay running.
customer_reviews.text: Worst purchase I have ever made through Amazon. Very hard to start and when I am finally able to keep it running, it stalls each time I engage the blade. I have used it 3 times to edge and have finally given up trying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: The price of this edger was good; however, the reviews regarding the blade turning in the wrong direction are spot on. The only way to get a nice edge is to move backwards. In addition, i have problems staring the machine. This is especially true after it has been run for a while. I have to let it complete cool off and then try again.,
customer_reviews.author: WWF

customer_reviews.title: but I am very satisfied. It was also easy to assemble and the ...
customer_reviews.text: Since I got it at the end of the mowing season, I was only able to use it once, but I am very satisfied. It was also easy to assemble and the directions were easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Hard to start
customer_reviews.text: Nice edger but hard to start. Once started it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: swarper

customer_reviews.title: Making your lawn look professionally  manicured
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves it first time was very hard but now that he keeps up with the lawn edges he is happy.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I glad I got this!!! Don't take nowhere near the time It takes to use a Weedwacker
customer_reviews.author: BIGSHUNN

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: easy to but together and runs great. My wife wanted it I sure wish she world us it.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Strong machine able to do the work made for the machine to do.
customer_reviews.text: Machine good looking. Well built, strong motor used it for the first time the machine never hesitated at all. Very pleased with it for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Pete in Dallas Ga.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Dislike that it vibrates and shakes more than any edger I've had. Not impressed and wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Southland SWLE0799 79cc Walk Behind Gas Lawn Edger
product_meta.description: Lawn edger with 3-1/2-feet.-lb. torque, 79cc horizontal OHV engine. Both EPA & CARB 2009 compliant. Unit has easy to start features with curb-hopping and horizontal drive. Triangular 3 point blade with angle that adjusts +/-15 degrees for bevel edging with 5 depth positions and up to 2-1/2-inch deep. 2 year limited warranty.
feature_bullets: Manual recoil easy start fuel delivery system
Adjustable to 5 depth positions up to 2 ½-inch deep
Blade angle adjusts +/- 15 degrees for bevel edging capabilities
Metal frame and blade guard for increased durability
Fuel the stabilizer if the edger is kept unused for 30 days.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars324 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
